results.title: Battlestar Galactica. Vol. 03
results.brief_description: In Part One of ‘The gun on ice planet zero’, Starbuck and Boomer discover a small, icy planet known to the Cylons as Arcta while on a deep space mission with three cadets. A sudden beam from a laser built into a mountain on Arcta obliterates one of the cadets, and Cylon interceptors appear, forcing one of the other cadets to land on the surface. Adama becomes convinced that the Galactica is being herded toward the planet as part of a Cylon plot, and orders a team of prisoners specially recruited for the job to accompany Apollo on a mission to attack the Cylon garrison and destroy the laser cannon. On Arcta, Apollo is assisted by a group of Theta-class clones, who reveal that their “father-creator” Dr. Ravashol was responsible for designing the weapon. Baltar, back in charge, orders more basestars to attack the Galactica. In Part Two, Apollo must help evacuate the clones from their underground city before the weapon can be destroyed. As Cylons pour into the villages, searching for the missing landing party, it becomes a race against time to disable the Cylon command centre and demolish the weapon before it can be used against the Galactica. Stars Lorne Green as Adama, Richard Hatch as Apollo, Dirk Benedict as Starbuck, Noah Hathaway as Boxey, and John Colicos as Baltar.

results.title: Battlestar Galactica. Vol. 02
results.brief_description: In ‘Lost planet of the Gods’, Apollo and Serina are finalising details of their impending marriage, and Apollo is starting to feel pressured to follow suit. Both go on what Starbuck believes may be their last Viper scouting mission together, only to fly into a vast black void that scrambles their navigation and communication equipment. They manage to find their way out, not realising that Baltar - hiding on his base-star in the magnetic void - has allowed them to escape so he can track them back to the battlestar Galactica. Meanwhile, Boomer and Jolly discover a Cylon outpost stationed on the surface of an asteroid, and rush back to warn the Galactica, unaware that the Cylons had seen them. Bypassing the decontamination process in order to get to Apollo’s bachelor party, both men suddenly succumb to an unknown virus, and Dr. Salik orders the quarantine of all of the Galactica’s Viper Corps except Starbuck and Apollo, rendering the ship defenseless. In order to synthesise a cure, Dr. Salik must return to the asteroid to find the cause, so Adama orders the recruitment of female shuttle pilots for Viper training so they can protect him from attack. Catching the outpost by surprise, the newly recruited Viper pilots defeat the Cylon fleet. In Part Two of ‘Lost planet of the Gods’, Adama directs the Galactica to fly into the void earlier discovered by Apollo and Starbuck in search of the mythical planet Kobol. While out intercepting another Cylon strike force, Starbuck is captured, and taken to Baltar, who claims the Cylons want peace. Meanwhile, back on the Galactica, with the threat of attack hanging over the ship, Apollo and Serina marry. The Galactica is guided to a remote planet by a star as foretold in the Book of the Word, and upon landing, Adama, Apollo and Serina realise that they have found Kobol. However, Baltar is waiting for them, anxious to make amends and negotiate peace. As the Cylons attack the planet, Adama discovers clues as to the path of the “thirteenth tribe”, and Baltar is punished for his treachery. However, the discoveries made are soon overshadowed by the tragic death of one of the Galactica’s inhabitants. Stars Lorne Green as Adama, Richard Hatch as Apollo, Dirk Benedict as Starbuck, Jane Seymour as Serina, Noah Hathaway as Boxey, and John Colicos as Baltar.

results.title: Battlestar Galactica [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Richard Colla, Leslie Stevens, John Dykstra and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: There are those who believe that life here began out there with tribes of humans who may have been the forefathers of The Egyptians, or the Toltecs, or the Mayans. That they may have been the architects of the Great Pyramids or the lost civilizations of Lemuria, or Atlantis. Some believe that there may yet be brothers of man who even now fight to survive somewhere beyond the Heavens. The Alliance, supported by the cyber-mechanical Cylon Empire, and the Twelve Colonies of Man have finally agreed to set aside their differences and to sign a peace treaty negotiated by Count Baltar that will end a conflict that has been raging for a thousand years. However, while on a routine reconnaissance mission in his Viper, fighter pilot Apollo finds evidence that the treaty is in fact a trap for the unsuspecting Colonies. Dogged by a contingent of Cylon Raiders, he warns Adama, Commander of the Battlestar Galactica of the deception, but the President of the Colonies, under Baltar’s treacherous influence, fails to act. As a result, all of the defending battlestars succumb to Cylon attack, with only the Galactica surviving the carnage. As the Cylons systematically begin to destroy the Colonies, Adama rounds up all the survivors, and the motley fleet set off in search of the legendary thirteenth colony, Earth. However, starvation soon takes its toll on the survivors, and the fleet are forced to stop at the mining planet Carillon. The insectoid Ovian inhabitants offer hospitality to the refugees, but Adama is suspicious of the riches that seem too freely available, and sends Apollo and Starbuck to keep an eye on proceedings. While attending a special event celebrating peace on the planet’s surface, they make a terrifying discovery that could bring about the apocalyptic elimination of every last human in the galaxy. This film, derived from the first three hour pilot episode of the short-lived cult TV series of the same name, stars Lorne Green as Adama, Richard Hatch as Apollo, Dirk Benedict as Starbuck, Jane Seymour as Serina, and Noah Hathaway as Boxey.

results.title: Battlestar Galactica
results.brief_description: When an old enemy, the Cylons, resurface and obliterate the 12 colonies, the crew of the aged Galactica protect a small civilian fleet - the last of humanity - as they journey toward the fabled 13th colony, Earth.

constellations_other.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_other.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

constellations_other.name: Aquaman VFX
constellations_other.description: As well as becoming a global box-office sensation, Aquaman (2018) featured groundbreaking visual effects from Australian companies such as Method Studios.

results.description: When an old enemy, the Cylons, resurface and obliterate the 12 colonies, the crew of the aged Galactica protect a small civilian fleet - the last of humanity - as they journey toward the fabled 13th colony, Earth.

results.title: Battleships at war (S)
results.creator_credit: Michael Campbell, David McWhinnie, Castle Co-Production and Lamancha
results.brief_description: The armoured battleships of the world’s navies are undoubtedly the most awe-inspiring vessels ever to have sailed the seas. The battleship reigned supreme in naval warfare from the beginning of this century to 1945, and German rearmament ensured that the heavily-armed queen of the seas played a major part in World War II. This program includes archival footage covering Admiral Cunningham’s fleet, led by HMS Warspite, in the Mediterranean, various other battleships in North Africa, Sicily, Italy and the D-Day landings as floating weapons platforms pounding shore-based enemy positions, and finally Japan’s signing of their surrender on the USS Missouri. Narrated by Patrick Allan.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This renowned Soviet feature portrays the mutiny aboard the Russian battleship Potemkin and the role of the sailors and citizens of the Port of Odessa in the abortive revolution of 1905. An epic dramatisation, it brought to the attention of the world the theories of Sergei Eisenstein, his emphasis on montage, stress on intellectual content and his treatment of the mass instead of the individual as protagonist.

results.title: Battleship Potemkin
results.brief_description: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resultant public demonstration, showing support, which brought on a police massacre. The film had an incredible impact on the development of cinema and is a masterful example of montage editing.

constellations_other.name: Auteurs, influence and inspiration
constellations_other.description: A tradition of influence and inspiration beginning with Eisenstein.

results.description: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resultant public demonstration, showing support, which brought on a police massacre. The film had an incredible impact on the development of cinema and is a masterful example of montage editing.

results.title: Battleground
results.creator_credit: William Wellman, Dore Schary and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: It is the dead of winter and GIs are dug in near the strategic crossroads of Bastogne. They are surrounded, outnumbered and bombarded with a steady barrage of incoming fire. Ammunition is low and it looks as if the fog will never lift. The Germans, sensing victory, demand surrender - and receive a strong reply from the American commander. Winner of the Best Screenplay and Best Cinematography Academy Awards, this movie is a landmark portrait of triumph under fire dedicated to the honour all soldiers and resonates with the humour, fear and bravery of civilian soldiers put to the test in the greatest conflict the world has ever known.

results.title: Battlefield pilot
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Dept. of Defence
results.brief_description: Australian Army pilots are among the best low level fliers in the world. The film demonstrates their skill by observing in depth a low level training flight by an Army pilot in a Pilatus Porter aircraft.
